channel.title: I'm back with some new models
channel.description:
I doubt anyone here remembers me, but I'm back and learning to model again. Here's two new models of mine.
A guitar: [IMG]http://i623.photobucket.com/albums/tt314/Time_of_Rune/GuitarRender.png[/img]
And a jetpack: [IMG]http://i623.photobucket.com/albums/tt314/Time_of_Rune/JetPackRender.png[/img]
A redo of the JetPack: [IMG]http://i623.photobucket.com/albums/tt314/Time_of_Rune/NewJetpackRender.jpg[/img]
Well, that's all for now. I hope to make some good models in the future :)

item.title: I'm back with some new models
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:32, topic:334933”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=431326.msg3167567#msg3167567 date=1270151891]

no no no, don’t bevel, just use “move” tool more often, it really helps lol.

Professionals bevel.
[/quote]
I was unaware that your recently gained the status of professional.[/quote]
It happened sometime last week
Lol jk
I’m just saying, the bevel tool is there for a reason

Read full topic

item.title: I'm back with some new models
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Mr_Biosoft, post:21, topic:334933”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=431326.msg3167832#msg3167832 date=1270167815]
Ok so you have your rectangular object of sorts. That line in the middle is fucking annoying, so get rid of it.
Idc if you have to make a new one, just get rid of it, it’ll make this hella lot easier. Actually, based on what I see, just have the rectangular prism.(fig1)
Grab the bevel tool(fig1) and select one of the side lines (fig2) and in the little box, put in 10 (fig2). Apply to all sides.
You should now have figure III.
Now delete the top parts (fig IV), and apply the faces back inside with the create tool (fig IV)
When you’re done, should have figure V!

106kgsx.jpg452×586

Remember, you may continue to bevel a line (manually) as long as the 2 lines pulling apart don’t intersect
[/quote]

this is helpful to more than just him. I havnt started tinkering with the bevel tool yet so I may give this a try soon[/quote]
I’ll make it a whole topic.

Read full topic
item.source: I'm back with some new models

item.title: I'm back with some new models
item.dc:creator: @Mr_Biosoft Mr_Biosoft
item.description:
@Mr_Biosoft wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:20, topic:334933”]Ok so you have your rectangular object of sorts. That line in the middle is fucking annoying, so get rid of it.
Idc if you have to make a new one, just get rid of it, it’ll make this hella lot easier. Actually, based on what I see, just have the rectangular prism.(fig1)
Grab the bevel tool(fig1) and select one of the side lines (fig2) and in the little box, put in 10 (fig2). Apply to all sides.
You should now have figure III.
Now delete the top parts (fig IV), and apply the faces back inside with the create tool (fig IV)
When you’re done, should have figure V!

106kgsx.jpg452×586

Remember, you may continue to bevel a line (manually) as long as the 2 lines pulling apart don’t intersect[/quote]

this is helpful to more than just him. I havnt started tinkering with the bevel tool yet so I may give this a try soon

Read full topic

item.title: I'm back with some new models
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

Ok so you have your rectangular object of sorts. That line in the middle is fucking annoying, so get rid of it.
Idc if you have to make a new one, just get rid of it, it’ll make this hella lot easier. Actually, based on what I see, just have the rectangular prism.(fig1)
Grab the bevel tool(fig1) and select one of the side lines (fig2) and in the little box, put in 10 (fig2). Apply to all sides.
You should now have figure III.
Now delete the top parts (fig IV), and apply the faces back inside with the create tool (fig IV)
When you’re done, should have figure V!

106kgsx.jpg452×586

Remember, you may continue to bevel a line (manually) as long as the 2 lines pulling apart don’t intersect

Read full topic

item.title: I'm back with some new models
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

Darque Star:

i was telling the topic starter >.<

No one cares, if people don’t want to come to your topic don’t post links to it.

I agree with Biosoft.

The Detail and colors are just all out plain.

The jet pack you can tell was made with prims. But you need to smoothen the edges to make it look realistic.
